fields.description: How positive the song is, from 0 (more negative) to 1 (more positive.
The year the song was released.
A measure of how confident Spotify's algorithm is that a track is acoustic, from 0 (not acoustic) to 1 (very confident the song is acoustic).
The artists who performed on the song.
How suitable a track is for dancing from 0 (not danceable) to 1 (most danceable).
How long the track is in milliseconds.
Energy is a measure from 0 to 1 of how intense or active a track is.
Whether a track is explicit (1) or not (0).
The Spotify ID for the track.
Confidence interval of whether a track contains no vocals - the closer the value is to 1.0, the more likely it has no vocals.
The musical key the track is in, using Pitch Class notation(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pitch_class).
Higher values represent an increased likelihood that the track was performed live.
The average loudness of the track in decibels.
Whether the track is in a major scale (1) or minor scale (0)
How popular the track is on Spotify from 0 to 100, based on number of plays and how recent those plays are.
The higher the value, the more the track is speech-like (e.g. spoken word poetry, or an audio book).
The tempo of the track in beats per minute (bpm).

card.description: A dataset of 20,000 songs from 1991 to 2020 with features like danceability, loudness, popularity, tempo, and more.

context.potential_uses: Predict a song's danceability based on its tempo and its positivity.
